subject: RE: [junit] Need help!!
msgSnippet: The Unit test approach is write the test before the code . So, if your code is done then yes it s too late. Then there isn t any unit test approach. Just
messageBody:
The Unit test approach is "write the test before the code". So, if your code
is done then yes it's too late. Then there isn't any unit test approach.
Just stick to use-case tests.

Morten

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Sukhvinder Singh Namdhari [mailto:snamdhari@...]
> Sent: 26. februar 2004 07:36
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: [junit] Need help!!
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I have query regarding Unit Tests, I want to write unit tests for
> my Server application, but till now we haven't wrote any testing
> code, the application is ready and we are doing Smoke tests and
> regression tests. Anyone could suggest how I could apply unit
> test technique in the existing Server Application, what should be
> the approach for Unit tests.
> Any help would be appreciable.
>
> thanks,
>
> Jims.
>
